pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:4.1: 7. The training rule on taking sides with one who has been ejected
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:5.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:5.2: At that time the nun Thullanandā took sides with the monk Ariṭṭha, formerly a vulture-killer, who had been ejected by a complete Order.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:6.1: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:6.3: “How could Venerable Thullanandā take sides with the monk Ariṭṭha who has been ejected by a complete Order?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:6.4: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:6.7: How can the nun Thullanandā take sides with the monk Ariṭṭha who has been ejected by a complete Order?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:6.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:6.9: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:7.1: ‘If a nun takes sides with a monk who has been legitimately ejected by a complete Order in accordance with the Monastic Law and in accordance with the Teacher’s instruction, who is disrespectful, who has not made amends, and who has not made friends, the nuns should correct her in this way:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:7.2: “Venerable, this monk has been legitimately ejected by a complete Order according to the Monastic Law and according to the Teacher’s instruction; he’s disrespectful, he has not made amends, and he has not made friends; Venerable, don’t support this monk.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:7.3: If that nun still continues as before, the nuns should press her up to three times to make her stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:7.4: If she then stops, all is well.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:7.5: If not, she too is expelled and excluded from the community. The training rule on taking sides with one who is ejected.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:8.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:9.2: belonging to the same community, staying within the same boundary.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:10.2: who has been ejected for not seeing an offense, for not making amends, or for not giving up a view.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:11.1: Legitimately […] in accordance with the Monastic Law:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:11.2: in accordance with that legitimate act, in accordance with that Monastic Law.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:12.1: In accordance with the Teacher’s instruction:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:12.2: in accordance with the Conqueror’s instruction, in accordance with the Buddha’s instruction.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:13.2: he does not heed the Order, groups of monks, individual monks, or legal procedures.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:14.2: he has been ejected and not reinstated.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:15.2: monks of the same community is what is meant by “friends.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:15.3: He is not together with them—therefore it is called “who has not made friends.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:16.2: she has the same view, the same belief, the same persuasion as he does.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:17.2: that nun who supports one who is ejected.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:18.2: Other nuns, those who see it or hear about it. They should say,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:18.4: “Venerable, this monk has been legitimately ejected by a complete Order in accordance with the Monastic Law and in accordance with the Teacher’s instruction; he’s disrespectful, he has not made amends, and he has not made friends;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:18.5: Venerable, don’t take sides with this monk.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:18.6: And they should say this a second
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:18.8: If she stops, all is well.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:18.9: If she does not stop, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:18.10: If those who heard about it do not say anything, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:18.11: That nun, even if she has to be dragged into the middle of the Order, should be spoken to thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:18.12: “Venerable, this monk has been legitimately ejected by a complete Order in accordance with the Monastic Law and in accordance with the Teacher’s instruction; he’s disrespectful, he has not made amends, and he has not made friends;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:18.13: Venerable, don’t take sides with this monk.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:18.14: They should say this a second
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:18.16: If she stops, all is well.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:18.17: If she does not stop, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:18.19: “And, monks, she should be pressed in this way.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:18.20: A competent and capable nun should inform the Order:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:19.1: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Order to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:19.2: This nun so-and-so is taking sides with a monk who has been legitimately ejected by a complete Order in accordance with the Monastic Law and in accordance with the Teacher’s instruction, who is disrespectful, who has not made amends, and who has not made friends. And she keeps on doing it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:19.3: If it seems appropriate to the Order, the Order should press her to make her stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:20.1: Please, Venerables, I ask the Order to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:20.2: This nun so-and-so is taking sides with a monk who has been legitimately ejected by a complete Order in accordance with the Monastic Law and in accordance with the Teacher’s instruction, who is disrespectful, who has not made amends, and who has not made friends.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:20.3: And she keeps on doing it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:20.4: The Order presses her to make her stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:20.5: Any nun who approves of pressing her to make her stop should remain silent.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:20.6: Any nun who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:21.1: For the second time I speak on this matter …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:21.2: For the third time I speak on this matter …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:22.1: This nun so-and-so has been pressed by the Order to make her stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:22.2: The Order approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:23.1: When the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing expulsion.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:24.2: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses entailing expulsion.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:25.2: just as an ordinary stone that has been broken in half cannot be put together again, so a nun who does not stop when pressed three times is not an ascetic, not a daughter of the Sakyan— therefore it is said “she is expelled.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:26.2: Community: common legal procedures, the same recital, the same training— this is called “community.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:26.5: She does not take part in this— therefore it is called “excluded from the community.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:27.1: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as legitimate, but she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing expulsion.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:27.2: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure if it is, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing expulsion.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:27.3: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing expulsion.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:28.1: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:28.2: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure if it is, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:28.3: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as illegitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:29.3: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:30.1: The seventh offense entailing expulsion is finished.
